document_content.title: Referral to General Medicine for Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Carter presents with a 3-month history of persistent fatigue, generalized malaise, and occasional headaches. Symptoms have not improved despite adequate rest and lifestyle modifications.

sections.heading: Relevant History
sections.content: No known chronic medical conditions. No recent travel, infections, or significant psychosocial stressors reported. Family history is non-contributory. No current medications except for occasional acetaminophen.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vital signs within normal limits. Physical examination unremarkable; no lymphadenopathy, organomegaly, or neurologic deficits noted.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Initial blood tests including CBC, TSH, renal and liver function tests are within normal ranges. Iron studies pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistence of symptoms and unremarkable initial workup, I am referring Ms. Carter for further evaluation and management. Please assess for possible underlying medical causes of her fatigue.
